Text saved: A stereotype is an idea about all people from one group. This idea is often not true.

It is good to know about different things. People from different places can think and act in different ways. This helps us stop problems when we talk. But we must remember one thing. Stereotypes about countries are bad. They can stop us from making good work friends.

People from one country can act in a certain way. This can make us act and think in a certain way. But many other things also make us who we are. For example, the place we live. Or the groups we are part of. Our age and if we are a man or a woman also change us. Our company's way of working changes us. What happens to us in life also changes us.

So, it is good to know about possible differences. We should remember them a little. But we must not use them to judge all people from a country. Every person is different.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL
